<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ASan, HWASan and Memtag sanitizers have some instrumentation that applies</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// specifically to global variables.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#ac9ed467b801e291e5873caed022b1858">SanitizerMetadata</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#ac9ed467b801e291e5873caed022b1858"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#ac9ed467b801e291e5873caed022b1858">SanitizerMetadata</a>()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlight">        : <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#af14cbae5c1ca7ff03eaa9c66d41e0940">NoAddress</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/false">false</a>), <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#a3c6f90fc4359e4c8cc2ad7333254f3c7">NoHWAddress</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/false">false</a>),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlight">          <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#a06dd653fcfff7260ea2ab89cc39029cb">Memtag</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/false">false</a>), <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#ac1da5875b7fe84a87d30ef1a90524c1c">IsDynInit</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/false">false</a>) &#123;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For ASan and HWASan, this instrumentation is implicitly applied to all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// global variables when built with -fsanitize=&#42;. What we need is a way to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// persist the information that a certain global variable should &#42;not&#42; have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// sanitizers applied, which occurs if:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   1 The global variable is in the sanitizer ignore list, or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   2 The global variable is created by the sanitizers itself for internal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      usage, or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   3 The global variable has &#95;&#95;attribute&#95;&#95;((no&#95;sanitize(&quot;...&quot;))) or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//      &#95;&#95;attribute&#95;&#95;((disable&#95;sanitizer&#95;instrumentation)).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is important, a some IR passes like GlobalMerge can delete global</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// variables and replace them with new ones. If the old variables were</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// marked to be unsanitized, then the new ones should also be.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#af14cbae5c1ca7ff03eaa9c66d41e0940"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#af14cbae5c1ca7ff03eaa9c66d41e0940">NoAddress</a> : 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#a3c6f90fc4359e4c8cc2ad7333254f3c7"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#a3c6f90fc4359e4c8cc2ad7333254f3c7">NoHWAddress</a> : 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Memtag sanitization works differently: sanitization is requested by clang</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when &#96;-fsanitize=memtag-globals&#96; is provided, and the request can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// denied (and the attribute removed) by the AArch64 global tagging pass if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it can&#39;t be fulfilled (e.g. the global variable is a TLS variable).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Memtag sanitization has to interact with other parts of LLVM (like</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// supressing certain optimisations, emitting assembly directives, or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// creating special relocation sections).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Use &#96;GlobalValue::isTagged()&#96; to check whether tagging should be enabled</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for a global variable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#a06dd653fcfff7260ea2ab89cc39029cb"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#a06dd653fcfff7260ea2ab89cc39029cb">Memtag</a> : 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ASan-specific metadata. Is this global variable dynamically initialized</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (from a C++ language perspective), and should therefore be checked for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ODR violations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#ac1da5875b7fe84a87d30ef1a90524c1c"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/globalvalue/sanitizermetadata/#ac1da5875b7fe84a87d30ef1a90524c1c">IsDynInit</a> : 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a6d863ff0d778248ac9b693db3494565c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a6d863ff0d778248ac9b693db3494565c">hasSanitizerMetadata</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a07e6feb9f188917f8dc965f78317f181">HasSanitizerMetadata</a>; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/globals-cpp/#a10cb67723d2bc5e94b23799094b28dd4">SanitizerMetadata</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a10dbf1e2be9c60af49efb9bfded99225">getSanitizerMetadata</a>() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Note: Not byref as it&#39;s a POD and otherwise it&#39;s too easy to call</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// G.setSanitizerMetadata(G2.getSanitizerMetadata()), and the argument becomes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// dangling when the backing storage allocates the metadata for &#96;G&#96;, as the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// storage is shared between &#96;G1&#96; and &#96;G2&#96;.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if the currently visible definition of this global (if any) is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// exactly the definition we will see at runtime.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Non-exact linkage types inhibits most non-inlining IPO, since a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// differently optimized variant of the same function can have different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// observable or undefined behavior than in the variant currently visible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For instance, we could have started with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   void foo(int &#42;v) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     int t = 5 / v&#91;0&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     (void) t;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and &quot;refined&quot; it to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   void foo(int &#42;v) &#123; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// However, we cannot infer readnone for &#96;foo&#96;, since that would justify</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DSE&#39;ing a store to &#96;v&#91;0&#93;&#96; across a call to &#96;foo&#96;, which can cause</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// undefined behavior if the linker replaces the actual call destination with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the unoptimized &#96;foo&#96;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Inlining is okay across non-exact linkage types as long as they&#39;re not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// interposable (see \\c isInterposable), since in such cases the currently</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// visible variant is &#42;a&#42; correct implementation of the original source</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// function; it just isn&#39;t the &#42;only&#42; correct implementation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a008adb117253c7a0dde2f796be489d65"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a008adb117253c7a0dde2f796be489d65">isDefinitionExact</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> !mayBeDerefined();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if this global has an exact defintion.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a52355f8a15cd7cedfe83bd82b59e942a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a52355f8a15cd7cedfe83bd82b59e942a">hasExactDefinition</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// While this computes exactly the same thing as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// isStrongDefinitionForLinker, the intended uses are different.  This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function is intended to help decide if specific inter-procedural</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// transforms are correct, while isStrongDefinitionForLinker&#39;s intended use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is in low level code generation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> !<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a32e606ac4c88f71f14212e42b808e7f4">isDeclaration</a>() &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue/#a008adb117253c7a0dde2f796be489d65">isDefinitionExact</a>();</span></CodeLine>
